title: 110_hr1376
content: The Act titled "Medicaid Foster Care Coverage Act of 2007" establishes independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage. The Act establishes independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage, with amendments to the Social Security Act and conforming amendments. The Act includes amendments to the Social Security Act regarding Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents. Amendments involve changes to specific sections of the Act, such as section 1902 and section 1903. The Social Security Act is amended in various sections regarding Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents. Amendments involve changes to specific subsections, such as 1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XVII) and 1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XVIII). The Social Security Act is amended in various sections related to Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents. The amendments involve changing specific subsections, such as 1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XVII) and 1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XVIII), with an effective date starting from October 1, 2007. The Social Security Act has been amended to include changes in specific subsections related to Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents, with an effective date starting from October 1, 2007. Amendments may require State legislation for compliance. In the case of a State with a 2-year legislative session, each year is considered a separate regular session of the State legislature.
